content.description: Crux is up high where it gets very steep and feet get thinner. A very pumpy route with shake-outs, stays very overhung to the chains. The exit moves can be intimidating, until you snag the "hidden" side-pull(s). Good holds through-out.
content.protection: 10 +- draws and biners at the top.
content.location: Second route from the left in the cave.

content.description: The climb didn't seem like it recieved much traffic but I thought it was an Ok route. They're were a couple loose rocks to the left of the anchor.
content.location: Leftmost route on the Cragganmore wall.

content.description:
Climb big cobbles to rest under the mini-roof section. Definitive crux move (atypical of MC) to pull the bulge, but eases off to the anchors.

Named after a scotch, like most of the others on the wall.
Pumpy jug haul with crux up high. Hold on and pull a few crimpers to the chains. Climbs just right of the large roof.
content.location: Located one route to the right of "50" (50 is written at the base of the route)

content.description: Needs traffic to clean this route.
Long route starting on slightly overhanging wall. Long pulls to rest under roof. Definitive crux move at the lip.

Follow juggy holds and a nice flake towards Black Water Fall anchors.  When you near the chains for the Black Water Fall and seem to run out of bolts, traverse right and up.  Clip one more bolt and keep going to your own chains further out to the right.
content.location: Walk around the right side of Cragganmore and hike up the hill to belay.  You will see two bolted routes on a vertical face.  The right one is Fat Man Fetish and the left is The Black Water Fall.

content.description: Start with a long pull on sloping cobbles and trundle up the long overhung face resting where you can. Climb through the middle of the capping roof with cool movement on cobbles and a long move thrown in. Uninspiring finishing holds finish this one off.
content.location: This route is just left of 50 and climbs up too and through the middle of the capping roof at Cragganmore.

content.description:
Climbs cobble to the large roof. Fun (glued) holds and movement to pull the lip on the left side of the arch. In the spring, there is a dirt/sand on the upper ledge.

Graded 12b in DK's guide/12d in Pegg's guide.

Crux is about midway as the holds thin out a bit and you have to commit. Sustained with ok feet and slopey hands. Looks slabby but actually a bit overhung in the middle  then vert at the top. Balancey throughout. Fun with a nice view.
content.location: Hike up the right side of Craggamore. It's the route on the left. In the black streak.

content.description: Really good pumpy climbing to a pretty good rest then punch through the right side of the large roof.
content.location: Route name is written at base.  Basically climbs the right side of the large roof.
